commit message:
Merge pull request #12 from JBirdVegas/gradleStuff

Implement release for gradle.  This will bump the version code/name.  Build the project.  Commit the new version.properties, then create a tag of the current code state.

From there jenkins will perform the upload to google play.  Should all happen with the click of a single button to trigger the mGerrit.org/jenkins mGerrit-Release build
Force jenkins to be on Master before attempting to commit
Add checkout logging; hopefully this will provide some insite on why the version.properties commit fails on jenkins

Merge pull request #16 from JBirdVegas/jenkinsBranch

Jenkins branch
Fix changing branch to master before writting version.properties

Merge pull request #17 from JBirdVegas/branchJenkins

Fix changing branch to master before writting version.properties
Fix incorrect root directory.  Since the groovy script runs in app/ it assumes that is the top of the repository... its not we have to specify the correct dir
